info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 12:51PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Moffat and north central Rio Blanco Counties through 115 PM MDT... At 1251 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 24 miles northeast of Rangely, or 46 miles west of Craig, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Moffat and north central Rio Blanco Counties, including the following locations... Elk Springs. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 36 and 37. Colorado 64 between mile markers 38 and 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
